title: Famous Chicken Adobo Recipe
description: Delicious chicken adobo with tender, juicy chicken cooked in a rich and flavorful vinegar pepper sauce that's simple to make and great with rice.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Chicken Chicken Adobo Recipes Famous Chicken Adobo 4.5 (364) 294 Reviews 45 Photos This chicken adobo recipe is simple to make and loved by all who try it! It has been modified to be a bit saucier than traditional adobo and is delicious served over rice. By angelaBBf Updated on September 19, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 45 45 45 45 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 (3 pound) chicken, cut into pieces 1 large onion, quartered and sliced 2 tablespoons minced garlic ⅔ cup low sodium soy sauce ⅓ cup white vinegar 1 tablespoon garlic powder 2 teaspoons black pepper 1 bay leaf Directions Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken pieces until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add onion and garlic to the skillet; cook until softened and brown, about 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour in soy sauce and vinegar and season with garlic powder, black pepper, and bay leaf. Return chicken to pan, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until chicken is tender and cooked through, 35 to 40 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 736 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 361 Calories 22g Fat 7g Carbs 33g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 361 % Daily Value * Total Fat 22g 28% Saturated Fat 6g 28% Cholesterol 97mg 32% Sodium 1040mg 45% Total Carbohydrate 7g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 2g Protein 33g 66% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 35mg 3% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 392mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Famous Chicken Adobo 01 of 45 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 45 Photo by  Steve 04/11/2022 Really simple recipe. Minimum prep time. Tastes great. 03 of 45 Photo by  Frances Smith 07/19/2021 This was my first encounter with chicken adobo, and I really liked it. The soy sauce is the prevailing flavor (my husband loved this) and overall the dish was easy to make, although you need to be patient and give it time to brown. I made some rice to go with this so I could soak up some of the sauce. An instant hit. 04 of 45 Photo by  Alicia Fajardo Wagner 04/22/2021 05 of 45 Photo by  Big Poppa 03/11/2021 been using this recipe since I found it...my kids love it 06 of 45 Photo by  Miriam Sarai Villanueva Lage 02/20/2021 07 of 45 Photo by  Wondreia Johnson 12/12/2020 08 of 45 Photo by  Whitney Scott 09/22/2020 Great recipe I fried my chicken first in coconut oil, removed excess oil and added the sauce mixture. Simmered on low until sauce thickened. Use liquid aminos instead of soy sauce for a healthier and amazingly delicious alternative. 09 of 45 Photo by  Miquisha Dauenbaugh 05/28/2020 10 of 45 Photo by  Brenda Wood 01/22/2020 It was delicious ... 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Pinoy Chicken Adobo 38 Ratings Slow Cooker Filipino Chicken Adobo 17 Ratings Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken 848 Ratings Chicken Adobo I 49 Ratings Adobo Chicken with Ginger 370 Ratings Pork and Chicken Adobo 9 Ratings Lolah's Chicken Adobo 65 Ratings Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk) 48 Ratings Slow Cooker Adobo Chicken with Bok Choy 206 Ratings Filipino Chicken Adobo 2 Ratings Guinataan Chicken Adobo 36 Ratings Instant Pot Filipino Chicken Adobo 31 Ratings Chicken Salpicao 1 Rating Siopao Chicken and Pork Filling Chicken Tinola 101 Ratings Authentic Chicken Adobo 20 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: angelaBBf
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken pieces until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Add onion and garlic to the skillet; cook until softened and brown, about 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Pour in soy sauce and vinegar and season with garlic powder, black pepper, and bay leaf.;Return chicken to pan, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until chicken is tender and cooked through, 35 to 40 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
